alert.note: Alert for Hockley; Lubbock (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 24 at 5:15PM CDT until May 24 at 7:30PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: .Areas of moderate to heavy rain will move over parts of Lubbock, Hockley and Cochran Counties that received very heavy rains last night. This will cause minor flooding. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Texas, including the following counties, Cochran, Hockley and Lubbock. * WHEN...Until 730 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 510 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated moderate to heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Much of this area is very wet and even light amounts of additional rain will cause minor flooding. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.1 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Portions of Cochran, Hockley, and Lubbock Counties - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
